channel.title: Touch Screen on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Touch Screen on 0x000216

item.title: How BlackBerry Touch Screen Technology Works
item.description: The BlackBerry Storm is a unique addition to the BlackBerry lineup, featuring a touch screen instead of the traditional physical QWERTY keyboard. Though the keyboard is now virtual, it still aims to provide a tactile experience. Why this change? Primarily, to accommodate a larger display screen without increasing the phone’s overall size. To achieve this, the physical keyboard was removed, leaving only essential call, menu, and navigation buttons below the screen.

item.title: Craving the Motorola ZN4 Krave
item.description: The Motorola Krave ZN4’s unique design, reminiscent of futuristic helmets, features a protective visor. This “touch cover” can be lifted to interact with the full touchscreen or closed to shield the display while still allowing access to essential functions like the camera, media, and messages. This design combines the appeal of both flip phones and touchscreen devices, offering a large screen ideal for media consumption and showcasing the capabilities of the phone’s 2.
